title: What's keeping yahoo in business? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is owned by Verizon so Verizon is funding and keeping it alive. Yahoo is still a fairly high traffic site.. from people still using Yahoo mail (which I still use) and with Yahoo search, Verizon can collect people's personal data and make money off it just like what Google, Facebook, and Amazon does. A lot of rural Americans and old people still use Yahoo.. Yahoo used to be very big back in the day and those old folks still have it as their default homepage. A big thing with Yahoo too is Yahoo News, weather, sports, and fantasy football. So there's still a lot of activity on Yahoo and a lot of people still use it (especially older rural Americans). Verizon just announced their Yahoo Mobile discount cellphone plan.. same thing as Metro PCS, Cricket, Virgin Mobile, Boost Mobile, etc. Verizon is now joining the cheap budget cellphone network business… it's important to know these budget MVNO cellphone networks are not as fast as their parent company networks and speeds will be throttled.

Yahoo! as a company no longer exists, so it's not technically still in business in its original form. Verizon purchased all of the assets except for a few which were held back (most notably the Alibaba stake and the patent portfolio, although there may be other assets in there that I’m not aware of) and merged it with AOL (which they already owned) and changed the company name to Oath, and now Verizon Media Group. The company which owns the held back assets was renamed to Altaba, and the assets which Verizon bought like Yahoo Mail, Yahoo News, and Yahoo Finance continue to live on as web/mobile properties owned by Verizon Media Group, which is owned by Verizon.

Yes, very much so. They are very popular in parts of the world and certain Yahoo services are used/prefered in many parts of the world. For instance, “Yahoo Finance” is widely used in many countries by people who have discovered their strength in this area. Google has never been strong when it comes to finance-portals. “Yahoo mail” is widely used in large part of Asia for instance. However other services are competing well and taking users from Yahoo. Yahoo is not the greatest in any area worldwide, but they have a fair share of loyal users. I use “Yahoo Finance”.
